channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Oxenton village sign, 10th October
item.description:
Road sign to village missing/ lying on ground. This is a safety hazard leading to late braking before vehicles turn into the village.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A435, Bishops Cleeve

item.title: Danger for safety as overgrown bushes, 5th October
item.description:
I went out and cut these back last myself last night. This is the result, but as demonstrated in the picture, the bus has had to move out into the road to avoid hitting a pedestrian. This is a main school run route and there have been a few near misses. The path is over grown so you canâ€™t safely push a pram and have a toddler walking beside. This is a accident waiting to happen. It all needs digging up so there is space to walk safely as grows aggressively. I have done my best to help avoid any accidents. Now over to you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 112 Station Road, Woodmancote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road works signage, 4th October
item.description:
These road signs have been here many months after they where needed. I have asked for them to be removed several times WHEN WILL THEY BE REMOVED!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cobweb Corner Fiddler's Green Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tip on Blind Bend / Field Gate/ Passing Place, 4th October
item.description:
The location is Mill Lane towards the Ham Road Junction. The tip has been put in a Field Gate entrance which also acts as a Passing Place on the narrow blind bend. Please can it be removed as soon as possible as vehicles are tending to hit the material and dragging it into the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Mill Lane, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet
